programme.title: New Life
programme.desc: Baby animals beguile with their innocent charm. But while some remain harmless, others have a deep-rooted instinct. It may take weeks or months of training to hone their skills. Their landscapes and lifestyles maybe very different, but these babies are born to hunt.

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II
programme.sub-title: S02 : E02 Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II: Kinabatangan River: Borneo – Forgotten Paradise
programme.desc: In Sabah, northern Borneo, flows the 560km-long Kinabatangan River. Nowhere else in Sabah are wild animals as easily spotted as along this river: orangutans, elephants, crocodiles, and proboscis monkeys. However, biodiversity is threatened as more rainforest gives way to palm oil plantations. Wildlife ventures into inhabited areas in search of food, leading to conflicts. Locals are fighting to preserve the rainforest and its unique wildlife, demonstrating that conservation and prosperity can coexist even in a modern society.

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II
programme.sub-title: S02 : E03 Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II: Pu Mat National Park: Vietnam – Of Bears and Men
programme.desc: The jungle in northern Vietnam is nearly impenetrable, with some areas never touched by humans. The remote rainforests of Pu Mat National Park serve as a refuge for endangered wildlife such as black bears, monkeys, and pangolins. Tuan, a biologist and bear specialist, embarks on an expedition to these untouched regions of the park in search of bears. The most hunted animal here is the pangolin, sought after for its scales believed to have medicinal properties and its meat considered a delicacy. A small Vietnamese conservation organization fights for the survival of this species.

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II
programme.sub-title: S02 : E04 Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II: Gaoligongshan Park: China – Himalaya’s Gold
programme.desc: The Great Gobi National Park in southwestern Mongolia shelters one of the last populations of wild Bactrian camels, amid its ancient and mysterious desert landscape. With around 800 critically endangered animals, the Gobi remains one of the worlds most sparsely inhabited and inhospitable regions, yet its allure is undeniable, offering a captivating backdrop for encounters with wild camels and stories of people deeply connected to nature.

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II
programme.sub-title: S02 : E05 Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II: Great Gobi National Park: Mongolia – Following the Wild Camels
programme.desc: The jungle in northern Vietnam is nearly impenetrable, with some areas never touched by humans. The remote rainforests of Pu Mat National Park serve as a refuge for endangered wildlife such as black bears, monkeys, and pangolins. Tuan, a biologist and bear specialist, embarks on an expedition to these untouched regions of the park in search of bears. The most hunted animal here is the pangolin, sought after for its scales believed to have medicinal properties and its meat considered a delicacy. A small Vietnamese conservation organization fights for the survival of this species.

programme.title: Faroe Islands - A Secret Beauty
programme.desc: The Faroe Islands in the North Atlantic, located in the middle of the Gulf Stream between Scotland and Iceland, are an archipelago of eighteen green volcanic islands where a unique culture has developed over the last thousand years. As direct descendants of the Vikings, the Faroese feel committed to their traditions and hold on to customs, without missing out on the advantages of the modern and globalised world - from archaic hunter and shepherd culture to contemporary art. With the highest birth rate in Europe and the lowest social inequality in the world, the just fifty thousand Faroese are a very special people living on one of the last natural paradises in Europe.

programme.title: mareTV: The white wilderness in Greenlands East
programme.desc: Fjords, glaciers and the highest mountains in the Arctic: East Greenland with its spectacular nature is one of the most sparsely populated regions on earth. The people here live in extreme isolation and depend on helicopter flights for their supplies. Despite harsh conditions, the inhabitants here lovingly maintain their traditions and enjoy their outdoor leisure time even at minus 20 degrees Celsius. The town of Tasiilaq is the "metropolis" with 4,000 inhabitants and offers a very special attraction: the only ski lift on the east coast. Thomas Mikaelsen, the lift attendant, is not to be envied for his job. The only 100 meter long lift comes from Switzerland and is already 20 years old....

programme.title: Magical Moors
programme.desc: Wide open heaths, windswept and barren in winter, are transformed into wonderful carpets of white, fluffy cotton grass in summer. Large bears and wolves roam alongside delicately fluttering butterflies, the bubbling calls of black grouse and the enchanting trills of the great snipe. Moors, bogs and wetlands can be found all over in Europe. Everyone has at least heard about this habitat but most know little about it. It is an ancient yet largely unknown set of landscapes that is full of enchanting surprises. On a warm spring day, poisonous adders emerge from hiding to perform their impressive mating dance. As dusk falls, snipe gather on traditional leks, leaping and singing to impress the...

programme.title: The Sudheide - Woods, meadows, open country
programme.desc: Forests and fields, moors and heathland, shepherds and sheep - these are the symbols of an ostensibly unspoilt landscape that has inspired poets and painters alike for centuries. The secret of the almost 500 km² nature reserve Naturpark Sudheide lies in its diversity: the origins of its soil, geology and topography can be traced back to the ice age. But the region between Hamburg and Hannover is anything but unspoilt. For centuries, it was synonymous with heathland farmers and formed as a North German cultivated landscape. This documentary tells of an almost unknown region, which has been strongly influenced by mankind for centuries, yet still remains diverse in its nature. Nature...

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Wild Life, Gentle Nature
programme.desc: As contrasting as the landscapes of the 15th meridian east, so different are its animal inhabitants. What are the living conditions like in the heat of the Namibian Damaraland, in Lusatia or on the coast of Norway? Which challenges do elephants, whales or kingfishers have to master together with their companions from north to south?

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: Almost 11000 kilometres lie between the northernmost and southernmost point of the 15th meridian east. Here you will find extreme landscapes such as the shimmering heat of Africa or the eternal cold of northern Scandinavia. Five people from Spitsbergen, Namibia, Slovenia, Germany and Poland dedicate their lives to environmental protection.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Sow, Harvest, Eat – Our Conservatory
programme.desc: This episode focuses on people from five countries who share a common passion: The production of their own food and food. What culinary treasures are hidden in the different regions, from Spitsbergen to Sweden, Austria, Poland and Chad?

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 From Generation to Generation
programme.desc: The journey leads from the Norwegian Vesterålen to Chad, the Aeolian Islands and the Polish Giant Mountains. As different as the landscapes and cultures may be, all people are united in their love for their children and their desire to give something to tomorrows generation.

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: What ideas are people on the 15th meridian east developing to shape the future and leave tomorrows generations a home worth living in? This consequence leads us to four future designers. From the barren Namib Desert to the glacier worlds of Spitsbergen, Sicily and the Croatian Mediterranean.

programme.title: Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II
programme.sub-title: S02 : E01 Asia - Secret Lives Hidden Places II: Gir National Park: India – Asia’s Last Lion
programme.desc: In the far west of India, unexpected predators roam: lions. Living freely in a human-inhabited area without fences, they occasionally prey on the livestock of the indigenous Maldhari people, who nevertheless take pride in sharing their region with these lions—a unique coexistence of humans and predators. In northern Gujarat, desert landscapes dominate, where semi-nomadic communities breed a unique camel breed capable of swimming: Karai camels swim up to 3km daily to mangrove islands for grazing.

programme.title: Faroe Islands - A Secret Beauty
programme.desc: The Faroe Islands in the North Atlantic, located in the middle of the Gulf Stream between Scotland and Iceland, are an archipelago of eighteen green volcanic islands where a unique culture has developed over the last thousand years. As direct descendants of the Vikings, the Faroese feel committed to their traditions and hold on to customs, without missing out on the advantages of the modern and globalised world - from archaic hunter and shepherd culture to contemporary art. With the highest birth rate in Europe and the lowest social inequality in the world, the just fifty thousand Faroese are a very special people living on one of the last natural paradises in Europe.

programme.title: mareTV: The white wilderness in Greenlands East
programme.desc: Fjords, glaciers and the highest mountains in the Arctic: East Greenland with its spectacular nature is one of the most sparsely populated regions on earth. The people here live in extreme isolation and depend on helicopter flights for their supplies. Despite harsh conditions, the inhabitants here lovingly maintain their traditions and enjoy their outdoor leisure time even at minus 20 degrees Celsius. The town of Tasiilaq is the "metropolis" with 4,000 inhabitants and offers a very special attraction: the only ski lift on the east coast. Thomas Mikaelsen, the lift attendant, is not to be envied for his job. The only 100 meter long lift comes from Switzerland and is already 20 years old....

programme.title: Magical Moors
programme.desc: Wide open heaths, windswept and barren in winter, are transformed into wonderful carpets of white, fluffy cotton grass in summer. Large bears and wolves roam alongside delicately fluttering butterflies, the bubbling calls of black grouse and the enchanting trills of the great snipe. Moors, bogs and wetlands can be found all over in Europe. Everyone has at least heard about this habitat but most know little about it. It is an ancient yet largely unknown set of landscapes that is full of enchanting surprises. On a warm spring day, poisonous adders emerge from hiding to perform their impressive mating dance. As dusk falls, snipe gather on traditional leks, leaping and singing to impress the...

programme.title: The Sudheide - Woods, meadows, open country
programme.desc: Forests and fields, moors and heathland, shepherds and sheep - these are the symbols of an ostensibly unspoilt landscape that has inspired poets and painters alike for centuries. The secret of the almost 500 km² nature reserve Naturpark Sudheide lies in its diversity: the origins of its soil, geology and topography can be traced back to the ice age. But the region between Hamburg and Hannover is anything but unspoilt. For centuries, it was synonymous with heathland farmers and formed as a North German cultivated landscape. This documentary tells of an almost unknown region, which has been strongly influenced by mankind for centuries, yet still remains diverse in its nature. Nature...

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Wild Life, Gentle Nature
programme.desc: As contrasting as the landscapes of the 15th meridian east, so different are its animal inhabitants. What are the living conditions like in the heat of the Namibian Damaraland, in Lusatia or on the coast of Norway? Which challenges do elephants, whales or kingfishers have to master together with their companions from north to south?

programme.title: 15th Meridian East - Similarity in Difference
programme.desc: Almost 11000 kilometres lie between the northernmost and southernmost point of the 15th meridian east. Here you will find extreme landscapes such as the shimmering heat of Africa or the eternal cold of northern Scandinavia. Five people from Spitsbergen, Namibia, Slovenia, Germany and Poland dedicate their lives to environmental protection.

programme.title: King of the Mountains - Golden Eagle
programme.desc: Aerial shots of mating Golden eagles, a clash between a Golden and a White-tailed eagle, and an intimate glimpse into their nesting grounds combine to create a spectacular film. Tracking these majestic birds reveals the wild nature of their hunting grounds, showcasing the diverse animal and plant life that share their habitat with the king of the skies. Viewers are brought up close as the eagle effortlessly glides over forests and canyons, abruptly diving in a breathtaking pursuit of prey. Witnessing these birds in their natural habitats is witnessing them at their finest. Embark on a magnificent journey through the skies and landscapes with us.

programme.title: King of the Seas - Sea Eagle
programme.desc: The times where eagles have been seen as varmints are over. They are now perceived as an integral part of the food cycle. Due to the fact that the habitats of the sea eagles in Germany are largely found in the north-eastern regions that are rich in water, the movie accompanies the eagles to an island, home to hundreds of sea ravens, where they rob the baby sea ravens of their food. They seem to always profit from the successes of the fellow creatures in their habitats. This film introduces you to the expert poachers of the animal kingdom.

programme.title: Leap Of The Lynx
programme.desc: On the Iberian Peninsula, primeval landscapes are practically non-existent, so the Iberian lynx has lived on cultivated land for centuries – cattle, horse and pig pastures, cork oak forests, timberland, and even holy sites of pilgrimage. The diversity and beauty of these locations are truly stunning and their character and history as relevant to this story as that of the big cat itself. Until five years ago, both populations of Iberian lynx were quickly fading away. Their fragmented habitats were shrinking even further, they were starved by lack of prey and reduced by epidemics. But now, local authorities, scientists, landowners, and other groups have finally begun to act in unison.

programme.title: Bear Essentials
programme.desc: We follow three young bears of different species – polar bears, brown bears and sloth bears (like Baloo, the Jungle Book Bear) – that inhabit dramatically varied landscapes as they find their way in the world. We look at how their mothers teach them the skills they need to survive and watch the many dangers they face. Their young lives are full of learning, moments of great tenderness and life-threatening drama. Over three years all of our bears, despite hardships and losses along the way, prove they have what it takes, they all have learned their bear essentials.

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Wild Moments: Dangerous and Deadly I
programme.desc: Wildlife film-makers often risk life and limb trying to capture unique images of their dangerous protagonists. In Alaska a cunning grizzly threatens the son of Andreas Kieling, on the remote Wrangel Island in northern-east Siberia his colleague Uwe Anders is taken by surprise by a a polar bear, and off the coast of South Africa a diving-team is unexpectedly surrounded by white sharks. But the life of the film-makers is also threatened by elemental forces, life-threatening diseases and failing technical equipment: Deep in the vast rainforests of West Africa cameraman Klaus Scheurich nearly dies of malaria, and in South India a film team narrowly escapes death in a hot-air balloon accident....

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Wild Moments: Dangerous and Deadly II
programme.desc: Wildlife filmmakers often risk life and limb trying to capture unique images of their dangerous protagonists. A cunning grizzly grabs a salmon off Andreas Kielings fishing rod, in the depths of the Amazon River a diving team has a spooky encounter with piranhas, in the Mediterranean Sea the currents nearly push Thomas Behrend into the mouths of angry sperm whales defending a newborn - and cameramen who want to film jaguars in the dense jungle of South America become easy prey for the well camouflaged cats. The life of the film-makers is also threatened by elemental forces and failing technical equipment: In the swamps of North Australia violent storms hold up the crossing of tearing...

programme.title: Wild Moments
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Wild Moments: Dangerous and Deadly III
programme.desc: Wildlife filmmakers often risk life and limb trying to capture unique images of their dangerous protagonists. In the Kruger National Park Josef Jozefowicz steps into a lionesses den to film her cubs, in Alaska Andreas Kieling mingles with giant elk bulls in order to film them in action, and in Florida his colleague Zoltan Torok gets very close to an alligator mother guarding its nest. The life of the film-makers is also threatened by elemental forces, and failing technical equipment: the strong and tearing current of the Yukon River throws Andreas Kielings boat onto a gravel bank, in the Democratic Republik of Congo camerawoman Heike Grebe is separated from her colleagues in the dense...

programme.title: Moksgmol - The Quest for the Spirit Bear
programme.desc: A forest that lives off fish, a white bear that is not a polar bear, and wolves that feed off the ocean… Canada’s Great Bear Rain Forest is a strange and pristine world, a land that time almost forgot. The awe-inspiring northern coastline of British Columbia with its great fjords that rival those in Norway, is the habitat of numerous species and the scene for the amazing co-existence of wolves, ravens, salmon, bears and a mystical rainforest, whose lives are intricately intertwined…

programme.title: The Moose Detective
programme.desc: Moose are an iconic species and of great importance to Sweden. That is why the country counts on a very special expert - the moose detective. Recently, a problem has developed on Öland regarding its moose. For a few years now on the island, the moose calves have been dying shortly after birth. Its a mystery. Every effort is made to save them. The island has called upon the moose detective to investigate. He follows several leads. Soon one of the suspects is identified - climate change. But it is not easy to convict the culprit. There are other suspects as well, the food shortage for example. Maybe they have joined hands as accomplices. In Sweden moose are very important. They are game...

programme.title: Search for the Ghost Bears
programme.desc: Our film journey begins in Alaskas west. We are hoping to find glacier bears in the glacial regions of the Katmai National Park on the Douglas River. At the end of July, brown bears have now arrived to fish for salmon. In the surrounding forests, grizzlies look for berries and fresh, green twigs. The Katmai is Alaskas most volcanic area, and with 15 active volcanoes it is a veritable powder keg, surrounded by glaciers. In the Hook glacier region moose and lynx accompany us. Bald eagles have arrived at the glacial boundary and begin to tear apart their freshly caught prey. At last, we catch sight of a glacier bear. Hungry, he has left the ice region and has been forced down here in...

programme.title: A Winters Tale - The Journey of the Snowy Owls
programme.desc: Snowy owls live a life full of mystery up in the Arctic. Thousands of years ago, they built a community of fate with their neighbors – lemmings. About every four years, lemmings proliferate in huge numbers. This way, snowy owls have enough feed for their young. The owls lay up to eleven eggs and can successfully raise the chicks – each of them needs two to four lemmings per day. Lately, however, lemmings’ mass reproduction hasn’t been as regular in some parts of the Tundra. What will happen to them and the snowy owls? What is the ecological link here? And what will happen if one year the winter arrives way too early? The best way for many birds to adapt to the winter is to flee to the...

programme.title: Survival of the Fittest in the Alps
programme.desc: The documentary shows the survival strategies of various animal species in the high mountains of the Alps in winter. Despite freezing temperatures and limited food supply, chamois, red deer and snow hares manage to survive the cold months. Latest research reveals the amazing abilities the animals have developed to adapt to the extreme conditions and also how climate change is altering the behaviour of the alpine inhabitants.

programme.title: Secret Life Of Deer
programme.desc: 30 million white-tailed deer live in the United States. They have begun to adapt themselves to living in a world of traffic, pets and backyards. In Cayuga Heights, New York, the suburb’s residents are trying to get used to this exceptional living arrangement. The deer can be spotted daily from kitchen windows and porches. Life in the suburbs is deer heaven – large areas of grass, no predators and plenty of water means their population is on a steady rise. In this documentary, white-tailed deer are outfitted with special cameras to take the viewer into their world. Deercam allows us to see them in a new light – not frozen in the headlights of a car or as shy residents of the woods, but...

programme.title: Strandwolf
programme.desc: She moves through the seal colony on Namibia’s wild Skeleton Coast with purpose and focus, gingerly stepping around the adults who snap at her heels. She’s searching for smaller prey. Following her is a young German field scientist, Ingrid Wiesel, who has now spent 17 years with Tosca’s clan; tracking, observing, and learning everything she can about one of the world’s least understood and most unusual predators.

programme.title: King of the Mountains - Golden Eagle
programme.desc: Aerial shots of mating Golden eagles, a clash between a Golden and a White-tailed eagle, and an intimate glimpse into their nesting grounds combine to create a spectacular film. Tracking these majestic birds reveals the wild nature of their hunting grounds, showcasing the diverse animal and plant life that share their habitat with the king of the skies. Viewers are brought up close as the eagle effortlessly glides over forests and canyons, abruptly diving in a breathtaking pursuit of prey. Witnessing these birds in their natural habitats is witnessing them at their finest. Embark on a magnificent journey through the skies and landscapes with us.

Bald eagles have arrived at the glacial boundary and begin to tear apart their freshly caught prey. At last, we catch sight of a glacier bear. Hungry, he has left the ice region and has been forced down here in...

programme.title: mareTV: Sardinia - Magical Island in the Mediterranean
programme.desc: Sardinia is the second-largest island in the Mediterranean. The Sardin-ians themselves say its a "continent for itself", a virtual world of its own, full of magic: A beach, gleaming in unreal pink shades, red corals protect against the evil eye and the inhabitants seem to remain forever young. On Sardinia, the owners of luxury yachts adopt sheep, fish have gold in their bellies and a giant mussel supplies the material for legendary sea silk. No one is surprised, that the Madonna goes on a sea cruise once a year.

programme.title: mareTV: Capri and the Amalfi Coast - Italys Ocean Legends
programme.desc: Capri was already in ancient times a place for the rich and beautiful. Today Capri is one of the most famous islands in the world. Millions of tourists visit it. But there are in fact still unknown corners on the island in the Gulf of Naples. Thus, at the very top of Capri, there is a hermit monastery with a view to the Vesuvius.

programme.title: Italy My Love
programme.desc: In ten coastal areas of Italy, we encounter people that have a very special relationship with their region. All of them love their country, their traditions and their work. We met with enthusiasts and hedonists that permitted us to take a glimpse into their everyday lives. Young Italians, who have rediscovered nature and its treasures. Others, that preserve the beauty, archaeologists that apply whole new methods, farmers that only cultivate that which the soil needs. Fishermen, who fish in the same way as it was done a century ago and tough, young men who play and dance the Tarantella. Dolphins, giant sea turtles and pink flamingos, which are researched, nursed back to health or simply...

programme.title: I Got a Monster: Americas Most Corrupt Police Squad
programme.desc: Retells in highly dramatic fashion one of the USAs biggest police corruption scandals. In 2017, Baltimore was rocked by the Federal indictment of Wayne Jenkins, a highly decorated supercop and leader of the Baltimore Police Departments elite Gun Trace Task Force along with six other members on racketeering charges.

programme.title: Forbidden Paradise, Part 1
programme.desc: The team is invited to Hawaii for a week to oversee new lifeguard techniques and relax a bit.

programme.title: Forbidden Paradise, Part 2
programme.desc: After Matt is stung by a poisonous fish they find a village where a young woman offers to help.

programme.title: Last Wave
programme.desc: Kaye is reunited with old flame Wes Masters. Stephanie undergoes surgery for melanoma.

programme.title: Go for the Gold
programme.desc: While in search of underwater treasure, Stephanie and Cody are confronted by drug smugglers.

programme.title: Shark Fever
programme.desc: Logan decides to write and direct a low-budget action film at the beach using a real shark.

programme.title: The Contest
programme.desc: When Mitch Judges the Miss Malibu Beach Bikini Contest his willpower is tested.

programme.title: Liquid Assets
programme.desc: Max, a secretly rich homeless eccentric man, suddenly dies and leaves CJ his fortune.

programme.title: Windswept
programme.desc: At the annual Baywatch Bachelor Auction, Mitch is "bought" for $5,000 by a wealthy socialite.

programme.title: Scorcher
programme.desc: LA is in the throes of a severe heat wave! Hundreds of thousands of people head to the beach.

programme.title: Beachblast
programme.desc: Mitch hires MTV DJ Jenny McCarthy to throw "Beachblast" to raise money for the Special Olympics.

programme.title: Guess Whos Coming to Dinner
programme.desc: CJs mother, a former Las Vegas showgirl, arrives in town to get away from her mobster ex-boyfriend.

programme.title: Let the Games Begin
programme.desc: Australias Uncle Tobys International Ironman Competition sparks a battle of the sexes.

programme.title: Buried
programme.desc: Controversy generated by Donnas appearance in Playboy magazine divides the Baywatch lifeguards.

programme.title: Search and Rescue
programme.desc: Fire chief Captain Huntingdon and the Baywatch team form an elite joint Search and Rescue unit.

programme.title: Heal the Bay
programme.desc: The team works with Heal the Bay after a recent rainstorm washes inland pollutants onto the beach.

programme.title: Bachelor of the Month
programme.desc: Mitch has been chosen Flash Magazines Bachelor of the Month, which causes some complications.

programme.title: Chance of a Lifetime
programme.desc: Stephanie and Tom go on their honeymoon in a two-mast schooner with a group of troubled teenagers.

programme.title: Talk Show
programme.desc: Mitch gets his “15 minutes of fame” when he rescues Jay Leno from choking.

programme.title: Life Guardian
programme.desc: Caroline, Neely and Manny rescue three orphan teenage boys from drowning.

programme.title: Matters of the Heart
programme.desc: Manny is haunted by his past when two juvenile delinquents from his hometown arrive at Baywatch.

programme.title: Rendezvous
programme.desc: When a young couple’s romance is threatened by their parents, they make a pact to end their lives.

programme.title: Hot Water
programme.desc: While testing new scuba diving technology, Sam, Neely and Caroline witness a jet crash.

programme.title: Trial by Fire
programme.desc: CJ and Cody transport an injured sea lion to the animal recovery facility at Sea World.

programme.title: Baywatch at Sea World
programme.desc: Caroline finds herself being sued for negligence in civil court by the mother of a drowning victim.

programme.title: Golden Girls
programme.desc: A crazed young woman is causing trouble on the Venice Boardwalk and Neely suspects something is up.

programme.title: Nevermore
programme.desc: A mysterious, disfigured man who the public dubs "the phantom lifeguard," is secretly saving people.

programme.title: Rookie Summer
programme.desc: Lifeguard candidates compete for a chance to attend Rookie School and become Baywatch Lifeguards.

programme.title: Next Generation
programme.desc: When a jet skier comes after April, Hobie finally shows that hes got Lifeguarding in his blood.

programme.title: The Choice
programme.desc: Veteran lifeguard Jack JD Darius and Taylor Walsh both vie for the open Lieutenant slot.

programme.title: Memorial Day
programme.desc: Mitch, Sky and April find a dead man at the bottom of the ocean and search for answers.

programme.title: Charlie
programme.desc: April has trouble dealing with her brother’s cancer, but Mitch helps her see how special he is.

programme.title: Lifeguard Confidential
programme.desc: The lifeguards are plagued by a reporter who knows too much and gets in the way.

programme.title: Out of the Blue
programme.desc: Seismic activity causes problems for the lifeguards.

programme.title: Eel Nino
programme.desc: When two sea lions are killed in an unexplainable event, Mitch must find the cause and stop it.

programme.title: Homecoming
programme.desc: Stephanie is kidnapped by an eco-terrorist. The Baywatch team must rescue her and save the day.

programme.title: Missing
programme.desc: When Cody breaks regulations, the Baywatch team makes a desperate attempt to locate a lost swimmer.

programme.title: Hijacked
programme.desc: Caroline is hijacked by a young thief who forces her to drive him in a wild getaway chase.

programme.title: No Way Out
programme.desc: A shark encounter leads Craig and April to take shelter in an intake pipe, avoiding deadly turbines.

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Mitch and Cody are taken captive after discovering a stolen cache of US Marine weapons.

programme.title: Surf City
programme.desc: As jet skiers threaten the safety of the surfers in the water, personal turmoil rages on the beach.

programme.title: To the Max
programme.desc: Cody, JD, and Lani try to make some extra cash collecting Sea Urchins to sell in the Far East.

programme.title: Night of the Dolphin
programme.desc: Garner Ellerbee returns and enlists Mitch’s help to track down a ring of offshore drug smugglers.

programme.title: Full Throttle
programme.desc: Cody makes a bet with some hotshots and Mitch ends up in a wild race with a finish no one expected.

programme.title: Quarantine
programme.desc: After a swimmer shows symptoms of a deadly virus, headquarters is quarantined.

programme.title: Diabolique
programme.desc: Neelys new nanny develops a deadly obsession with Mitch after he saves her from a boating disaster.

programme.title: Bon Voyage
programme.desc: Hobies good fortune lands him, Mitch, Cody and a jewel thief aboard a cruise ship to Alaska.

programme.title: White Thunder at Glacier Bay, Part 1
programme.desc: During a stop in Juneau, Leslie takes a clueless Hobie on the beginning a harrowing chase.

programme.title: White Thunder at Glacier Bay, Part 2
programme.desc: After rescuing a glacier-bound Hobie, Mitch returns with a romantic proposition for Neely.

programme.title: Milla: The Movie
programme.desc: THE WORST NIGHTMARE RESTS WHERE NOT EXPECTED

programme.title: Dead on Arrival
programme.desc: A pharmaceutical sales rep visits a small town in Louisiana on business. He finds himself in a dark world of corruption and murder with 24 hours to live, running from the police.

programme.title: I Remember You
programme.desc: Two strangers feel a supernatural connection after being involved in the same accident.

programme.title: Black Marigolds
programme.desc: Writer Ryan Cole and his Wife Kate go to an off season vacation house where he intends to finish his second novel. But their plans are changed by a devastating mental illness.

programme.title: Treasure Lies
programme.desc: Hardworking teenager Sean feels let down by life, but faces a crisis of character through a series of his own bad decisions.

programme.title: God and Salsa
programme.desc: A grief-stricken therapist determined to help a suicidal teen regains her faith in the process with the help of her Pastor and Salsa instructor.

programme.title: Who Will Move The Stone
programme.desc: A worldly Detroit lawyer decides to represent a Born Again Christian on trial for the murder of a Catholic Priest.

programme.title: Lucky Louie
programme.desc: A retired cop teams up with four ex-convicts and a behavioral science student to solve a fifty year old bank robbery in this new faith filled family comedy.

programme.title: Screened In
programme.desc: Peyton Hawthorne becomes disillusioned when she realizes her phone has taken over her life. She attempts to tackle her addiction but calamity ensues.

programme.title: In His Steps
programme.desc: When a homeless man interrupts the comfortable routine of First Church of Raymond, life will never be the same for the apathetic congregation.

programme.title: 6 Nonsmokers
programme.desc: Dr. Henry Caldwell, the world’s foremost mediator, faces the biggest challenge of his career when he takes on six roommates whose only thing in common is that none of them smoke.

programme.title: Beverly Hills Bandits
programme.desc: When bratty 5-year-old Byron Reed (Chris Williams) acts out the night before a family trip, his mother (Natasha Alam) makes him sit in the time out chair. When Byron awakens to an empty house, he assumes his wish to have no family has come true.

programme.title: Chelsea
programme.desc: When Chelsea’s best friend Laura gets engaged and moves out of their apartment, she’s left with more than an empty room.

programme.title: Promises
programme.desc: Latchkey kids lose touch when one of them moves away, only to reconnect years later without realizing it, having changed their names to escape their pasts. Once they realize who each other are; they are able heal the wounds of their pasts.

programme.title: Broke
programme.desc: A disgraced sports star and gambling addict attempts to turn his life around with the support of his number one fan.

programme.title: Eight
programme.desc: A woman suffering from Obsessive Compulsive Disorder (OCD) struggles with her morning routine of trying to get to work on time.

programme.title: The Dog Walker
programme.desc: A psychotic stalker forces a retired investigative journalist to solve a terrifying puzzle.

programme.title: The Wait
programme.desc: A mafia killer accepts to take the identity of his last victim in order to redeem his past. Two games of chess – one with his victim, the other with his boss – will stress the turning points of this change.

programme.title: Elephants
programme.desc: A true indie film through and through, Elephants takes an authentic look at a modern relationship in a "slice of life" style.

programme.title: More Beautiful for Having Been Broken
programme.desc: A female FBI agent befriends a woman and her adorable, young, special needs son who live in the countryside. The womens friendship soon turns into romance.

programme.title: Gold Fools
programme.desc: When a successful family man gets laid off, he leads his friends on a gold panning expedition in the mountains of Sonora, oblivious to what lurks where the water runs real deep.

programme.title: TangerineLAnd
programme.desc: Beth Harris is getting married. The only problem is, she already has a husband; pro-surfer, Sonny Baker.

programme.title: Fighting Chance
programme.desc: An MMA fighter who has worked his entire life for a shot at the title must overcome extraordinary trials if he is ever to achieve his dreams and find his true purpose in life.

programme.title: First Responders
programme.desc: After her husband suffers a life-changing fire, trauma therapist Karen Williams discovers the limits of her expertise and must face her own fears while trying to save her marriage.

programme.title: Everything I Am
programme.desc: A young teenage girl takes a homeless man into her home, to show the love of christianity in action.

programme.title: Core
programme.desc: A woman rediscovers a relationship shes neglected when her world comes crashing down.

programme.title: American Dream
programme.desc: The American Dream embarks on a journey with two college bound football buddies. They must decide between the fast money on the streets and keeping on a straight path.

programme.title: The Kiss of Lady X
programme.desc: A disgraced former secret agent risks his life as well as the lives of his ragtag team as he seeks revenge against the charismatic terrorist who killed his wife.

programme.title: Living with the Dead: A Love Story
programme.desc: A runaway girl, Max McLean, adventures into the forest with a young man named Ish who helps her find meaning in her boyfriend’s suicide.

programme.title: Best Of Seven
programme.desc: Jonnie Stapleton gives a comedic masterpiece virtuoso performance in his debut film, playing seven versions of himself, simultaneously.

programme.title: At the Frontera
programme.desc: When an ATF agent out of Houston is tasked to team up with the Mexico City District Attorney on a human trafficking case, he uncovers family ties with a serpentine real-estate developer. Now he must work with a criminal defense attorney to stop the reign of tyranny.

programme.title: Broken Contract
programme.desc: When Max, a down on his luck strip club owner, has his life and livelihood threatened by local gangsters, he turns to his wife’s connections for help and hires a hitman to solve the problem once and for all.

programme.title: About an Age
programme.desc: It’s Friday night and five friends on the cusp of adulthood gather at a house to celebrate the end of another school week.

programme.title: The Map Reader
programme.desc: In a small New Zealand town, 16 year-old Michael leads a lonely, introverted existence with his single mother Amelia whose guilt and alcoholism threatens to drive her cherished son away. Uncomfortable with the adolescent exploits of his “friends,” he finds escape through a passionate love of maps.

programme.title: Astronaut: The Last Push
programme.desc: When a tragic accident cuts short the first manned mission to explore life on the moons of Jupiter, Michael Forrest must make the 3 year journey home to Earth in pure solitude.

programme.desc: Ryan and Shane embark on a journey through Colchester Castles infamously haunted halls as they uncover its chilling past.

programme.title: BuzzFeed Unsolved
programme.desc: Ryan and Shane search the spine-chilling depths of Londons haunted catacombs and uncover some of historys darkest secrets.

programme.title: BuzzFeed Unsolved
programme.desc: Ryan and Shane stay overnight at the infamous Winchester Mansion, facing unexpected scares and chilling voices as they explore the eerie basement and haunted bedrooms.

programme.title: BuzzFeed Unsolved
programme.desc: Ryan and Shane explore the thrilling history of Yuma Territorial Prison, from outlaws to rumored hauntings.

programme.title: BuzzFeed Unsolved
programme.desc: Ryan and Shane unveil the governments UFO program as they discuss shocking new evidence of extraterrestrials.

programme.title: BuzzFeed Unsolved
programme.desc: Ryan and Shane explore the wild, haunted history of Tombstone, Arizona in search of gun-slinging ghouls.

programme.title: BuzzFeed Unsolved
programme.desc: Join Ryan and Shane as they make their first haunted house call to investigate Hannah Williams eerie home.

programme.title: BuzzFeed Unsolved
programme.desc: Ryan and Shane discuss Americas most top-secret military base and explore the haunted St. Augustine Lighthouse for paranormal activity.

programme.title: BuzzFeed Unsolved
programme.desc: Ryan and Shane explore the infamous club on Sunset Boulevard for signs of the missing faces that may still be haunting the halls of the former celebrity-filled establishment.

programme.title: BuzzFeed Unsolved
programme.desc: Ryan and Shane take on another house call as they investigate Loey Lanes haunted apartment.

programme.title: BuzzFeed Unsolved
programme.desc: Ryan and Shane visit the Conjuring House to find out if a demonic entity really is trapped behind its walls.

programme.title: BuzzFeed Unsolved
programme.desc: Ryan and Shane investigate an infamous rural Iowan home to see if it holds the spirits of its tragic history.

programme.title: BuzzFeed Unsolved
programme.desc: Ryan and Shane explore the Farnsworth House to see if the lost spirits of this historic battle remain in the inn.

programme.title: BuzzFeed Unsolved
programme.desc: Ryan and Shane investigate the Morris-Jumel Mansion to see if famous historical spirits roam its walls.

programme.title: BuzzFeed Unsolved
programme.desc: Ryan and Shane return to the place where their journey started to face Sallie the demon once and for all.

programme.title: BuzzFeed Unsolved
programme.desc: Ryan and Brent explore the thrilling theories surrounding the mysterious deaths of legends Tupac Shakur and Biggie Smalls.

programme.title: BuzzFeed Unsolved
programme.desc: Join Ryan and Brent on the hunt for clues as they delve into the chilling mystery of the Zodiac Killer.

programme.title: BuzzFeed Unsolved
programme.desc: Ryan and Shane take an in-depth look at the perplexing case of the Sodder childrens disappearanc and unravel the truth about the Micelle Von Emster case.

programme.title: BuzzFeed Unsolved
programme.desc: Ryan and Shane explore the spine-chilling tale of the Axeman Killer of New Orleans, a mysterious figure who terrorized the city in the early 20th century, leaving behind a trail of fear and intrigue.

programme.title: BuzzFeed Unsolved

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A man rams his wife’s car into his daughter’s car. Deputies find a rifle in a suspect’s car that was in a prior altercation. A man claims to run a travel business after deputies find evidence of id theft.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A man sneaking away from a bar fight claims he was chased by a truck. Deputies are called when a woman assaults people at a skating rink. A drunk man abandons his truck on train tracks.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers wrestle an uncooperative driver to the ground after a traffic stop. Deputies search for a man who sent threatening texts to his ex-girlfriend. Two suspects are caught stealing gas.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers respond to a call reporting an officer-involved fight. A brazen driver careens into a ditch after failing to yield. A berserk woman is pulled over for her erratic driving.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers make an arrest in connection to an armed robbery with the help of the K-9 unit. Officers respond to a disturbance call at a local restaurant involving the manager and an inebriated patron. An officer pulls over a vehicle which later turns out to be littered with drug paraphernalia.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: An officer struggles with a man reaching for something in his pocket. A man won’t cop to the gun in his backseat. Police arrive on the scene when a man threatens to shoot his wife.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A K-9 unit finds the suspect hiding in a shed. A cooperative suspect is faced with a list of charges. A motorcycle chase comes to an end after the suspect ditches the stolen bike and flees on foot.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A cyclist gets booked for trying to split when officers pull him over for a traffic violation. Two brothers struggle to explain why they took off in their truck when they saw the cops. A man takes a swing at his sister because she refuses to mow the lawn.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Police work a sting that targets drug dealers. An undercover sting discovers narcotics trafficking. Police respond to a burglary in progress and discover a flop house.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers pursue two suspects on foot who fled from a stolen vehicle. A drunk driver is pulled over after a brief chase. Officers receive a call for help from a juvenile about an attempted break-in.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers are called when a disturbed naked man covered in blood is spotted in a park. Officers find a nude couple in a U-Haul truck. A traffic stop over a minor violation turns into a dangerous pursuit.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A speedy suspect makes officers chase him through a creek. A teenage Good Samaritan gets in the middle of a bizarre domestic dispute. After a woman destroys her home, she begs police to arrest her.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A K-9 unit assists on a motorcycle pursuit turned foot chase gone awry. Officers investigate after noticing the garage door to an auto body shop is open. A pursuit involving a stolen vehicle driving on the wrong side of the freeway ends with an arrest.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S25 : E07 No Money, More Problems
programme.desc: A woman hides in her apartment after she skips out on paying her cab fare. A knife fight results in multiple calls to the police for help. A French tourist get a bus ride from Hell in Florida.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A normal traffic stop turns into an off-road race through a residential neighborhood. Police find a runaway suspect taking refuge in a family member’s closet. A domestic dispute erupts over chips and dip.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S13 : E01 Young and the Restless
programme.desc: Officers arrest a man suspected of robbery. A riot erupts at a juvenile party on the beach. Officers find an intoxicated man stuck on an iron fence.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: An uncooperative suspect obeys instructions from his more levelheaded relative. A dead ringer for “The Rock” uncovers some crack rock. Officers try to get the truth out of two known drug users.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers search for a runaway suspect with a weapons charge. A man admits to having a large number of drugs during a traffic stop. Officers respond to a man with a gun in an alley.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A stolen vehicle pursuit ends in a take down and recovery of additional evidence. A store employee flags down an officer who steps in to make a theft related arrest. An officer is accompanied by several units in pursuit of a stolen vehicle.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers are called when two intoxicated suspects decide to have some fun and vandalize a fence. Undercover officers set up a narcotics sting at a hotel. A man is found lying naked in a parking lot.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S16 : E05 Kiss and Make Up

programme.title: Cops

programme.title: Cops

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A couple gets into a fight with their in-laws when they attempt to take their baby on a 3am drive. Two suspects proclaim their innocence after walking away from a hit and run. A man is attacked by his roommate after he gets ‘too friendly’ with a woman in their home.

programme.title: Cops

programme.title: Cops

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers respond to a traffic accident after a man runs his truck through a wall. An undercover officer poses as a “john” and later a vehicle is stopped due to a missing license plate.

programme.title: Cops
programme.sub-title: S26 : E02 Who Let the Dogs Out

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A man can bail on child support payments, but can’t escape the police. One woman’s retaliation almost gets her girlfriend run over. A sluggish suspect denies the pile of marijuana in his car is his.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Police are in a high-speed chase with a car missing a tire. Police respond when a tow truck driver is assaulted by an apartment manager. Police are called when a relative attacks a woman’s husband.

programme.desc: Officers respond after two men kick in a womans door. Three suspects attempt to steal a bicycle in an alley. An officer arrests a husband for domestic abuse.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A suspect bites an Officer while trying to avoid arrest. An Officer responds to a stabbing. An Officer is flagged down by a concerned group looking for a missing 4-year-old.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers in Las Vegas make an arrest in a grand theft auto call with the help of the K9 unit. An uncooperative driver takes off in the middle of a traffic stop. A woman in Florida is rewarded for her honesty and is let go as her friends are arrested.

programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: A suspicious driver takes police on a neighborhood chase. Officers are called to capture a 12-foot python hiding outside a home. Officers suspect a funny walking motorist is hiding something in his shoe.

programme.desc: An Officer spots a gun in a vehicle during a routine traffic stop, but the passengers are denying ownership. programme.title: Cops
programme.desc: Officers hold a man under a car at gunpoint after a traffic stop. Officers are flagged down and directed to a couple arguing on the street. A man apologizes to detectives for the illicit items they find.

programme.title: Renegade

programme.title: Renegade
programme.desc: When Reno learns of a convicts escape, he heads for Chicago to protect the arresting officer, his father.

programme.title: Silk Stalkings
programme.desc: Rita and Chris go undercover on a movie set as executives when a local film crew is the target of militants.

programme.title: Silk Stalkings
programme.desc: A rapist returns to haunt Chris for sending him to jail.

programme.title: Silk Stalkings
programme.desc: A Palm Beach society outcast is murdered as he is about to reveal something he says will rock the community.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On May 17th 2005, a body is discovered in a forest of Sucy-en-Brie; Christophe Belle, 40 years old, a renowned pastry cook.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The disturbing missing case in Paris of a four year old.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On October 13th 1996, the body of young Angelique Dumetz, 18 years old, is recovered down a ditch in Oise forest. An important clue is found on the crime scene.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On February 23th 2017, policemen are alerted of the disapearrance of Brigitte Troadec, her husband Pascal, and their children Sebastien and Charlotte.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A Night of Horror at Devils Plateau (Marie-Jeanne Meyer Case) - On June 18, 2011, Marie-Jeanne Meyer, 17-years old, waved goodbye to her little sister before leaving for her daily jog on the heights of Tournon in Ardèche. She never came back. Three days later, her mutilated body was found in a freshly dug pit, near an area known to be cursed, "The Devils Plateau." Whats more, the crime scene looked like a mystical ritual ... Was it a ritual murder? Revenge? An unfortunate encounter? ...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A Mysterious Murder at the Farm (Valerie Bary Case)- On Friday, March 26, 2004, in the region of Dijon, Laurent Bary came home from his work to discover the lifeless body of his wife, Valerie, bathing in a pool of blood. According to the investigators initial findings, the 38-year-old nurses aid had been stabbed several times, seeming to validate the theory of a robbery gone wrong.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On July 13, 2011, two boaters retrieved a suitcase that was floating in the bay of Lorient. Inside, they discovered the tied up corpse of a man.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Bloody Christmas next to the Leman lake (CASE OF RUTH LÉGERET) - On January 4, 2006, Ruth Legeret was found dead in the middle of a pool of blood at her luxurious property in Vevey, Switzerland. Next to her was the lifeless body of her friend, Marina Studer. Who could have killed these two simple and wealthy widows? Clue after clue, the Swiss polices investigation would revolve around an environment of family jealousy and financial greed.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: September 16 2005. The lifeless body of Audrey Jouannet, 24, is found hidden under the bed in her small apartment in Soisy-sur-Seine. It soon becomes apparent that the young woman has been tortured at length before being strangled. But surprisingly, though the highly meticulous murderer has taken care to leave no sign of his passage, the autopsy reveals traces of sperm on the victim. It will take all of the investigators intuition to pierce the mystery of this heinous crime...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Sylvain Dromard finds the body of his wife Laurence lying in a pool of blood in the kitchen. The crime was particularly violent and the theory of a burglary that went wrong is soon excluded. But investigators dont understand who could want the adorable hairdresser of Saint-Martin-dAblois dead. During the investigation, the work of profilers will enable them to draw a very precise portrait of the murderer...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: After an ordinary dinner, Pierre and Gabrielle Labrell suffer severe abdominal pains.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Nelly Cremel, 39, leaves her home to go jogging... never to return. Eight days later, after a vast search campaign, her body is found. Theres no doubt that its murder. The case soon ignites public opinion, even inflaming passions at the highest level of the state. The clues lead investigators on a number of trails, from the shadows of the French secret service to a manhunt for a possible sex maniac, in a case of murder most foul.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Willy Pomonti, a retired architect, is found savagely murdered in his opulent villa in La Celle-Saint-Cloud, near Paris. It soon becomes clear that the man has been tortured prior to death. At several points during this extraordinary enquiry, police will feel theyre holding the culprit... It will take them ten years to finally shed light on this particularly violent crime.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The lifeless body of Christophe Lejard is found by his son just metres from their home. The man was shot in the head as he was getting into his car to go to work. A veritable execution, which at first glance doesnt square with the profile of the quiet family man. Yet behind the appearances, the investigation gradually reveals all the hate and resentment that revolved around the victim.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: A man walks into a gendarmerie near Saint-Malo to report that his wife has been missing since the previous day. The couple are going through a divorce, but this mother would never have left her seven children alone! An extensive search is undertaken but the woman cannot be found. What has happened to Adeline Piet? The investigation spans several years and experiences many twists.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: The corpse of Priscillia Ciatti, 14, is discovered by the side of a field, a few hundred metres from her family home. The teenager has been stabbed sixty times with a knife and -an extra sordid detail - a devil mask is found next to her body. Was Priscillia the victim of a prowler? A serial killer? A maniac inspired by a horror movie? Investigators soon find that the young girl felt she was being watched, and even threatened...

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: In the early hours of the morning, Mathilde Croguennec, 18, attending "Teknival" in Brittany, is found at the foot of a tree with her throat cut. Investigators face the task of finding the killer from among the 43,000 participants of this huge open-air festival of electronic music, where drink and drugs are consumed in abundance. An unusual investigation that leads the police down a number of false avenues.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: Arriving at her work, the secretary of a small firm in the suburbs of Geneva finds the body of Jean-Raymond Blatti, the companys new accountant. The man is lying in a pool of blood and, on his belly, the murderer has written "DIRTY RAPIST". Yet Jean-Raymond Blatti was never charged with sexual assault. Over the course of the investigation, this inscription will appear as one of the many mysteries of this case which is particularly rich in twists and turns.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On July 19th 2004, the naked and tied up body of a woman is recovered in the Ourcq canal in Fresnes-sur-Marne. The victim is impossible to identify.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On April 3th 2003, Chantal Ternik, a 48 year old housewife, is discovered hanged in her house of Sanary-sur-Mer, in Var.

programme.title: Crime Scene Solvers
programme.desc: On March 28th 2013, the burnt body of Anne Barbot, 38 years old, is discovered in a forest of Maine-et-Loire.

programme.title: Return to the Moon
programme.desc: The Apollo equipment has sat abandoned on the lunar surface for over 40 years. Now there is a renewed excitement and drive to return to the moon.

programme.title: First Steps to Mars
programme.desc: Humans seem to be on the cusp of reaching Mars, but how did we get to this point?

programme.title: Surviving Mars
programme.desc: Science may soon make the dream of traveling to Mars a reality, but how will we live once we get there?

programme.title: First Martians
programme.desc: Sometime in the future humans will leave Earth to colonize Mars, and in doing so will begin to adapt to life on another planet in surprising ways.

programme.title: Stephen Hawkings Favorite Places
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Stephen Hawkings Favorite Places
programme.desc: Commander Stephen Hawking pilots his space ship the SS Hawking on the journey of a lifetime, zooming from black holes to the Big Bang, Saturn to Santa Barbara.

programme.title: Stephen Hawkings Favorite Places 3
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Stephen Hawkings Favorite Places
programme.desc: Commander Stephen Hawking and his space ship the SS Hawking encounter an alien A.I., then race to the edge of the universe, and plunge into an alternate Earth.

programme.title: Stephen Hawkings Favorite Places 2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Stephen Hawkings Favorite Places
programme.desc: Commander Stephen Hawking takes another journey in his space ship, the SS Hawking, this time to Venus, the Sun and out to the Eagle Nebula.

programme.title: Destination: Pluto Beyond The Flyby
programme.desc: Join the New Horizons team to examine the latest findings and imagery from Pluto and the fringes of our solar system. They reveal a world unlike any other weve seen yet!

programme.title: Miniverse
programme.desc: Join astronaut Chris Hadfield, along with hitchhikers Michio Kaku (and others) on a joyride across our Solar System, scaled down to the size of the continental US.

programme.title: Return to the Moon
programme.desc: The Apollo equipment has sat abandoned on the lunar surface for over 40 years. Now there is a renewed excitement and drive to return to the moon.

programme.title: The Permian
programme.desc: Massive geologic changes allowed life to thrive on land and sea, producing saber-toothed carnivores like Gorgonopsid and the terrifying 40-foot shark Helicoprion.

programme.title: The Triassic
programme.desc: After the Permian period, the epic saga of evolution and extinction on Earth produced the worlds first dinosaurs, plesiosaurs and pterosaurs.

programme.title: The Cretaceous
programme.desc: Magnificent and terrifying dinosaurs like Triceratops and Tyrannosaurus ruled the land. But they were all wiped out in an instant by a collision with an asteroid!

programme.title: The Ordovician
programme.desc: For nearly 4 billion years, the continents of Earth were lifeless. But during the Ordovician, there was an explosion of life beneath the sea. Many creatures evolved.

programme.title: The Devonian
programme.desc: Life in the sea rebounded with a vengeance in the Devonian. Dozens of monstrous predators emerged, like the 40-foot long Dunkleosteus.

programme.title: Alien Life
programme.desc: Scientists investigate microbes found in Yellowstone National Parks thermal pools to understand the biology necessary for life at high temperatures.

programme.title: Frozen Archeology
programme.desc: There are places in Greater Yellowstone where the snow never melts, or at least, it never used to. Climate change is causing Yellowstone’s ice patches to recede.

programme.title: The Petrified Forest
programme.desc: Greater Yellowstone sits on top of a volcanic hot spot where devastating geological events unfolded. The result? A bizarre cemetery of fossilized forests.

programme.title: Mammoth Country
programme.desc: The Greater Yellowstone Area was once a rich grazing ground for huge Columbian mammoths. Now it’s a prime hunting ground for paleontologists and archaeologists.

programme.title: The Last Triceratops
programme.desc: Montana’s Hell Creek Formation is home to a trove of late Cretaceous fossils unlike any other in the world, revealing the last days of the great dinosaurs.

programme.title: Past and Future Yellowstone
programme.desc: Craters of the Moon National Monument is desolate – but 2,200 years ago, it was the site of today’s Yellowstone Hotspot, known for violent eruptions and huge craters.

programme.title: Worlds Best Dinosaur Fossil
programme.desc: An extraordinary new discovery of a dinosaur fossil so pristine and complete, that it shows off the texture, patterns, and color of a prehistoric giant. Discover this brand new species that roamed during the late Jurassic and Cretaceous periods.

programme.title: Recovering From Extinction
programme.desc: How long does it take for life to rebound after a major mass extinction? Scientists in Svalbard dig through fossil clues for surprising revelations about our Earths history.

programme.title: T-Rex Timeline
programme.desc: The Tyrannosaurus Rex is known as the king of the dinosaurs, but how did its reign begin? Meet Moros Intrepidus, a 180 lb., deer-sized ancestor to the T-Rex.

programme.title: Raising Dinos From The Dead
programme.desc: Could a 75 million-year-old dinosaur skull that has been sitting in a museum for over 20 years hold the first-ever dinosaur DNA discovered by humans?

programme.title: The Rise and Fall Of T-Rex
programme.desc: T-rex - the "tyrant lizard king" - ruled the earth 65 million years ago. Today, he reigns as the ultimate predator and pop cultural icon.

programme.title: The Permian
programme.desc: Massive geologic changes allowed life to thrive on land and sea, producing saber-toothed carnivores like Gorgonopsid and the terrifying 40-foot shark Helicoprion.

programme.title: The Triassic
programme.desc: After the Permian period, the epic saga of evolution and extinction on Earth produced the worlds first dinosaurs, plesiosaurs and pterosaurs.

programme.title: The Cretaceous
programme.desc: Magnificent and terrifying dinosaurs like Triceratops and Tyrannosaurus ruled the land. But they were all wiped out in an instant by a collision with an asteroid!

programme.title: The Ordovician
programme.desc: For nearly 4 billion years, the continents of Earth were lifeless. But during the Ordovician, there was an explosion of life beneath the sea. Many creatures evolved.

programme.title: The Devonian
programme.desc: Life in the sea rebounded with a vengeance in the Devonian. Dozens of monstrous predators emerged, like the 40-foot long Dunkleosteus.

programme.title: Alien Life
programme.desc: Scientists investigate microbes found in Yellowstone National Parks thermal pools to understand the biology necessary for life at high temperatures.

programme.title: Frozen Archeology
programme.desc: There are places in Greater Yellowstone where the snow never melts, or at least, it never used to. Climate change is causing Yellowstone’s ice patches to recede.

programme.title: The Petrified Forest
programme.desc: Greater Yellowstone sits on top of a volcanic hot spot where devastating geological events unfolded. The result? A bizarre cemetery of fossilized forests.

programme.title: Mammoth Country
programme.desc: The Greater Yellowstone Area was once a rich grazing ground for huge Columbian mammoths. Now it’s a prime hunting ground for paleontologists and archaeologists.

programme.title: The Last Triceratops
programme.desc: Montana’s Hell Creek Formation is home to a trove of late Cretaceous fossils unlike any other in the world, revealing the last days of the great dinosaurs.

programme.title: Past and Future Yellowstone
programme.desc: Craters of the Moon National Monument is desolate – but 2,200 years ago, it was the site of today’s Yellowstone Hotspot, known for violent eruptions and huge craters.

programme.title: Worlds Best Dinosaur Fossil
programme.desc: An extraordinary new discovery of a dinosaur fossil so pristine and complete, that it shows off the texture, patterns, and color of a prehistoric giant. Discover this brand new species that roamed during the late Jurassic and Cretaceous periods.

programme.title: Recovering From Extinction
programme.desc: How long does it take for life to rebound after a major mass extinction? Scientists in Svalbard dig through fossil clues for surprising revelations about our Earths history.

programme.title: T-Rex Timeline
programme.desc: The Tyrannosaurus Rex is known as the king of the dinosaurs, but how did its reign begin? Meet Moros Intrepidus, a 180 lb., deer-sized ancestor to the T-Rex.

programme.title: Raising Dinos From The Dead
programme.desc: Could a 75 million-year-old dinosaur skull that has been sitting in a museum for over 20 years hold the first-ever dinosaur DNA discovered by humans?

programme.title: The Rise and Fall Of T-Rex
programme.desc: T-rex - the "tyrant lizard king" - ruled the earth 65 million years ago. Today, he reigns as the ultimate predator and pop cultural icon.

programme.title: Part 1: Rise of Civilization
programme.desc: In the region that includes the Mediterranean, the Aegean, Mesopotamia and Egypt, the Bronze Age arrived about 3000 BC and lasted nearly 2000 years. What singled out this period and the new societies and cities that emerged? The development of formal writing is one among several important factors.

programme.title: Part 2: Masters Of Trade
programme.desc: Trade, and in particular trade in luxury goods, drove the commerce economies of the Bronze Age. This is the time when the first super powers in history, Egypt and Mesopotamia, emerge and dominate the "world" stage of the Mediterranean and Aegean seas and surrounding areas.

programme.title: Part 3: Conquest And Collapse
programme.desc: The Bronze Age had the first large urban centers, powerful kingdoms and armies, writing, and trade routes across vast areas. What led to the collapse of the city-state entities and the end of the Bronze Age? Possibly a perfect storm of uncontrollable factors that are still being researched.

programme.title: Pierce Arrow
programme.desc: 1913 38C Brougham - "built up to a standard, not down to a price" - was worth the value of several houses at the time, with the special cachet of being the first car owned by the White House.

programme.title: Duesenberg
programme.desc: The 1930 Model J Duesenberg was the pinnacle of automotive engineering in power and speed, holding records not surpassed until the 1960s.

programme.title: Terraplane
programme.desc: The Hudson Terraplane 1937 Series 72 was a fast and affordable car with unique style and innovative design. The company, unlike others, survived the Depression.

programme.title: Corvette
programme.desc: The 1963 Split-Window Stingray Coupe combined power, performance, precision and youthful design.

programme.title: Oldsmobile
programme.desc: The Oldsmobile F88 was a "dream car" of the GM Oldsmobile line, but the auto, despite its sophisticated, debonair styling, was destined never to see production.

programme.title: Mustang
programme.desc: The Ford Mustang Shelby GT-500 was born of the 1960s vibe and the racing experience of Carroll Shelby, who set speed records at Bonnevile salt flats.

programme.title: The Hunt for the Slave Ship Guerrero
programme.desc: A team of underwater archeologists searches for the remains of the Guerrero, an illegal slave ship sunk in battle off the coast of Florida.

programme.title: The Last Persian Shah
programme.desc: Shah Mohammad Reza Pahlavi would have been 100 years in October 2019. The Shahs story begins with good ideas and ideals and ends in bloody chaos.

programme.title: Radioactive Forest - 10 Years After
programme.desc: We look at the satoyama landscape ten years after the nuclear disaster at Fukushima Daiichi Power Plant which was followed by the 3.11 megaquake.

programme.title: Wind
programme.desc: This film follows the race to generate vast power from thin air - the wind. One of the worlds biggest windfarms is being built off the English coast.

programme.title: Aviation
programme.desc: The way we fly is about to change, driven by a new breed of aviators not afraid to think differently. Could the days of the jet age be numbered?

programme.title: Fusion
programme.desc: It is the greatest technological challenge ever undertaken by humankind. The quest to produce the ultimate energy solution‚ Fusion.

programme.title: Tidal
programme.desc: The power of the oceans tides is the last great untapped energy source on Earth. Teams of engineers race to perfect the technology to harness the vast flows of water.

programme.title: Maritime
programme.desc: Shipping companies and engineers are creating new machines to make their industry greener using a resource that has moved man across oceans for thousands of years...Wind.

programme.title: Solar
programme.desc: The sun is the biggest source of energy in the solar system. Innovators are searching for new ways to capture more of the suns power.

programme.title: The Race to Space
programme.desc: A new era of space, where small satellites no bigger than a shoebox will be deployed not in one or twos, but in their thousands, referred to as satellite swarms.

programme.title: Perpetual Power
programme.desc: All over the world, engineers and scientists are racing to solve one key problem; how to safely and efficiently store electricity at a huge scale but at a low cost.
